item.title: Abandoned roadworks, 5th November
item.description:
For the second day running, an abandoned hole with two way temp traffic signals is creating enormous queues in every direction from the site and with knock on effect from adjoining roads up and down Gloucester Road and Lansdown Road. This is a key trunk road. It is not acceptable for this critical blockage to be simply left with nobody working on the site. I assume I am one of hundreds who have already highlighted the issue. The combined financial and hardship cost associated with each individual vehicle affected must run into hundreds of thousands of pounds per day - all spread invisibly across thousands of people - and with no recourse to the company who have created the problem - and who suffer no financial consequences either.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 382, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On corner of tanners road/bramly road overgrown tree blockiig pavement, 5th November
item.description:
Corner oftanners road /bramley road tree overgrown blocking pavement which caused my wife to stumble on kerb and fall down luckily she only scraped her knee but feel something should be done before anything else happens thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18;20;22;24;26;28, Bramley Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Lights sequenced incorrectly causing problems, 5th November
item.description:
The light for the traffic going towards the centre of town has not been sequenced to take into account the nearby traffic lights on Gloucester Road. what that means is that the traffic traffic that way sits in the queue for the lights on Gloucester Road blocking access the traffic going the other way. I was travelling towards Benhall and had ti wait for 3 light cycles before I could get past the lights because the lane was blocked by traffic waiting for the Gloucester Rd light to change to green. I noticed a few cars ahead of me jumping the lights in order to get through. This is clearly dangerous and is likely to result in an accident before too long.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 382, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Noisy fire hydrant cover - not resolved, 5th November
item.description:
Fire hydrant cover - Pirton Lane, between bus stop and Rockatek building. Fire hydrant cover is still making banging noises every time a vehicle drives over it. Now starting to have an effect on sleep at night time. Please can this be fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
